scaffold.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a structure built next to a wall, for workers to stand on while they build, repair, or paint a building
scaffold.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a raised structure which was used in the past as a place to kill criminals by hanging them or cutting off their heads
scaffold.translation[0].definitions[2].d: a structure that can be moved up and down to help people work on high buildings
